popt4jlib.LIP

Class AdditiveSolver2

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.LIP.AdditiveSolver2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdditiveSolver3

    public class AdditiveSolver2
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    class implements a multi-threaded version of Balas' ADDITIVE algorithm for Linear Integer Programming. In particular, the solver solves Integer Programming problems of the form: min. c'x s.t. Ax ≥ b x ≥ 0 x integer vector where the matrix A, and the vectors b,c are given and contain integer values. The vector c should contain non-negative numbers in particular. In case the vector x is not restricted to binary values, then the system Ax ≥ b must be able to upper-bound each component of the vector x, so as to bring the program into the so-called standard binary format. Notice that this implementation uses sparse vectors which is likely to be useful in Integer Programs arising from applications of Graph Theory (e.g. packing problems etc., especially on sparse graphs). Also notice that this program is well-suited to the Fork/Join Task programming framework (Doug Lea and before him, the Cilk project at MIT). Nevertheless, in several experiments conducted, each Branch-and-Bound Node opened has significant processing to do before generating its new branches and therefore the contention among the threads is kept to very acceptable levels.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      (package private) static class  AdditiveSolver2.Node

      private static class  AdditiveSolver2.ON
      alternative to using java.util.LinkedList<Node> (which is a doubly-linked list implementation of list).

      • putInOrder

        private static void putInOrder(AdditiveSolver2.Node nd)
        puts the Node nd inside the list pointed to by _head, in order so that the Nodes' _v._z value is in ascending order (smallest value first). Synchronized operation.
        Parameters:
        nd - Node

      • remove

        private static void remove(AdditiveSolver2.Node nd)
        removes Node nd from the list pointed to by _head. Because we are picking nodes from the top of the list, this is a constant time operation (the node to be deleted is essentially the one that was just selected and processed, take or leave its two children). Synchronized operation.
        Parameters:
        nd - Node

      • selectNode

        private static AdditiveSolver2.Node selectNode()
        return the first element in the list pointed to by _head. It also removes the node containing this element from the list. Constant-time (synchronized) operation.
        Returns:
        Node

      • close

        sets the status of the Node argument to false (closed).
        Parameters:

      • updateZ

        private static void updateZ(AdditiveSolver2.Node current)
        updates the argument's _z value, as well as _zstar,_zbar,_optimal members if appropriate. Synchronized operation. Notice that the current node will always be complete (will have no free variables) when this method is invoked.
        Parameters:
        current - Node

      • imposeConstraint

        private void imposeConstraint(AdditiveSolver2.Node current)
        modifies this solver's vector's _b last (augmented) component, as well the matrix's _A last (augmented) row, if the condition _zbar < _csum holds.
        Parameters:
        current - Node

        processes the argument Node, possibly modifying the 2nd argument as well.
        Parameters:
        current - Node
        bbar - IntArray1SparseVector
        Returns:
        int the sum of the _c vector's coefficients for those components for which current._x' components are set to 1.

        Returns:

      • LU

        private void LU(AdditiveSolver2.Node current)
        upper- and lower-bounds the argument Node object. As a result the operation may close the node (as infeasible)
        Parameters:
        current -

      • selectVariable

        protected int selectVariable(AdditiveSolver2.Node current)
        protected method used to select a free variable given an open node. Current method chooses the free variable that setting to 1 provides the least "infeasibility" in the program, i.e. it's a greedy method.
        Parameters:
        current -
        Returns:
        int the index of the chosen variable (in [0,num_vars-1))

        Parameters:
        current - Node
        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • convertToBin

        private void convertToBin()
        converts a (bounded) Linear Integer Program to a Binary Program.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the problem cannot be converted to binary format.

      • initialize

        private void initialize(java.lang.String filename)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        initialize the data structures for the solver, reading data from the file containing the problem data. Each thread participating in the program execution calls this method to read the matrix A and the vector b in its own memory. The file must be formatted like this: <m> // _m number of constraints (augmented by 1) <n> // _n number of variables A_[0,.] row 0 values (one line): val1, val2, ... valn ... A_[m-2,.] row m-2 values (one line): val1, val2, ... valn b[0] first constraint rhs value ... b[m-2] last constraint rhs value
        Parameters:
        filename - String
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • initialize

        private void initialize(IntArray2SparseMatrix A,
                        IntArray1SparseVector b,
                        IntArray1SparseVector c)
        initialize the data structures for the solver. Each thread participating in the program execution calls this method to read the matrix A and the vector b in its own memory.
        Parameters:
        A - matrix A
        b - RHS vector b
        c - cost vector c

      • setup

        public static void setup()
        used with repeated invocations of the runMain() method.

      • printResults

        private static void printResults()
        prints results.

      • printFinalResults

        private static void printFinalResults()
        prints results for the original problem if conversion was needed.

      • run

        public void run()
        the run() method of the Runnable interface, runs the main loop of the solver until the optimal solution is found. It iteratively selects the first (best) Node n from the (shared)list of open nodes, imposes any constraints on it, computes it (updating the _bbar vector along the way), applies the tests it knows on it, and either closes the node as infeasible or optimal, or else branches on the chosen variable, by putting two new Node objects with appropriate values for the chosen variable on the shared list of open nodes.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • runMain

        public static IntArray1SparseVector runMain(IntArray2SparseMatrix A,
                                            IntArray1SparseVector b,
                                            IntArray1SparseVector c,
                                            int nt,
                                            AddSlvrFac solverFac)
        API method to invoke the algorithm, for Binary Programming only (no needing of any kind of conversion.)
        Parameters:
        A - the _m × _n augmented matrix
        b - the _m × 1 augmented RHS vector
        c - the _n × 1 cost vector
        nt - the number of threads to use
        solverFac - AddSlvrFac maybe null
        Returns:
        IntArray1SparseVector the best solution found

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        run the program from the command-line as: java <vm_args> -cp <classpath> popt4jlib.LIP.AdditiveSolver2 <filename> [contains_integer_variables?(T)] [num_threads(1)]
        Parameters:
        args -
